definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我在搬箱子的時候手指頭上紮了一根刺。

sentences.english: Hers is a manically full life.
sentences.chinese: 她的每一隻手指頭都是髒的。

sentences.english: Don't use these for a severed finger.
sentences.chinese: 千萬別用這些布袋子來盛切斷了的手指頭。

sentences.english: Well don't worry, you don't have to lift a finger.
sentences.chinese: 那麼別擔心，你連根手指頭都不用動。

sentences.english: The chewing of the gum will keep your mouth busy and spare your fingers.
sentences.chinese: 嚼口香糖會讓你的口腔繁忙，也能騰出你的手指頭了。

sentences.english: She can count all her partners on the fingers of one hand.
sentences.chinese: 她的伴侶，她用一個手的手指頭能數完。

sentences.english: In the old society the teacher often cracked the disobedient pupil's fingers with his ruler.
sentences.chinese: 舊社會老師經常用戒尺打不聽話的學生的手指頭。

sentences.english: Today, knocking the 4 experiments, good quickly, my fingers are flying.
sentences.chinese: 今天敲了4次實驗，好過癮，自己的手指頭都飛了。

sentences.english: Gina, can you stop sucking on Stacy's finger for one second?
sentences.chinese: 吉娜，你能不能先別吮斯德茜的手指頭了？

sentences.english: Start to whistle by putting two fingers in your mouth in a U-shape before blowing.
sentences.chinese: 吹氣前，先把兩根手指頭擺出U型放入口中。

sentences.english: My fingers got squeezed in the door.
sentences.chinese: 我的手指頭被門夾了一下。

sentences.english: Commuters fingers, life is not separated.
sentences.chinese: 勾勾手指頭，一輩子不分手。

sentences.english: The fire burned his figure and he cried.
sentences.chinese: 火燙了他的手指頭，他哭了。

sentences.english: He cut his finger deep and the blood flowed out.
sentences.chinese: 他把手指頭割得很深，血流了出來。

sentences.english: It had 35 teeth. Albertosaurus had short arms. It had two fingers on each hand.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾貝塔龍胳膊很短，每隻手上有兩個手指頭。

sentences.english: He sliced (into) his fingers by accident when cutting vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 他切菜時不小心切着了手指頭。

definition: to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
